test.name: Extract Data From A to B

kw.name: Connect To Database
kw.doc: Loads the DB API 2.0 module given `dbapiModuleName` then uses it to connect to the database using `dbName`, `dbUsername`, and `dbPassword`.
kw.msg: Connecting using : pymysql.connect(db=test1, user=root, passwd=***, host=localhost, port=3306, charset=None)
OperationalError: (2003, "Can't connect to MySQL server on 'localhost' ([WinError 10061] Aucune connexion n’a pu être établie car l’ordinateur cible l’a expressément refusée)")

kw.name: Query
kw.doc: Uses the input `selectStatement` to query for the values that will be returned as a list of tuples. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback. Set optional input `returnAsDict` to True to return values as a list of dictionaries.

kw.name: Disconnect From Database
kw.doc: Disconnects from the database. By default it's not an error if there was no open database connection - suitable for usage as a teardown. However you can enforce it using the `error_if_no_connection` parameter.

kw.name: Connect To Database
kw.doc: Loads the DB API 2.0 module given `dbapiModuleName` then uses it to connect to the database using `dbName`, `dbUsername`, and `dbPassword`.

kw.name: Set Variable
kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.name: Set Variable
kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.name: Execute Sql String
kw.arg: INSERT INTO test2 (id, Nom, Prenoms, Sexe) VALUES (${id}, '${Nom}', '${Prenoms}', '${Sexe}')
kw.doc: Executes the sqlString as SQL commands. Useful to pass arguments to your sql. Set optional input `sansTran` to True to run command without an explicit transaction commit or rollback.

kw.name: Disconnect From Database
kw.doc: Disconnects from the database. By default it's not an error if there was no open database connection - suitable for usage as a teardown. However you can enforce it using the `error_if_no_connection` parameter.

suite.doc: Extraire fichier d'une BD A vers une BD B

kw.name: Open Browser
kw.doc: Opens a new browser instance to the optional ``url``.

kw.name: Page Should Contain
kw.doc: Verifies that current page contains ``text``.

kw.name: Maximize Browser Window
kw.doc: Maximizes current browser window.

kw.name: Input Text
kw.doc: Types the given ``text`` into the text field identified by ``locator``.
kw.msg: Typing text 'orangehrm testing' into text field '//*[@id="APjFqb"]'.

kw.name: Mouse Down
kw.doc: Simulates pressing the left mouse button on the element ``locator``.

kw.name: Mouse Up
kw.doc: Simulates releasing the left mouse button on the element ``locator``.

kw.name: Click Button
kw.doc: Clicks the button identified by ``locator``.

kw.name: Sleep
kw.doc: Pauses the test executed for the given time.

kw.name: Set Screenshot Directory
kw.doc: Sets the directory for captured screenshots.
kw.msg: Keyword 'Set Screenshot Directory' found both from a custom library 'SeleniumLibrary' and a standard library 'Screenshot'. The custom keyword is used. To select explicitly, and to get rid of this warning, use either 'SeleniumLibrary.Set Screenshot Directory' or 'Screenshot.Set Screenshot Directory'.

kw.name: Take Screenshot
kw.doc: Takes a screenshot in JPEG format and embeds it into the log file.
